medical_history.chief_complaint: Headaches, cognitive changes, mood symptoms, flashbacks, chest pain, arm tingling, and gastrointestinal symptoms.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient experienced multiple symptoms following traumatic events during military service, with headaches persisting for over 6 years, chest pain, and gastrointestinal symptoms developing in the last 2 months. He reported a severe headache rated at 10/10, associated with sonophobia and photophobia. Symptoms progressed over time, with increased irritability and mood changes. Gastrointestinal symptoms included daily nonbloody emesis, persistent nausea, abdominal pain, and weight loss of 9 kg.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of obstructive sleep apnea; previous traumatic brain injury from a motor vehicle accident and exposure to explosive blasts; multiple evaluations and treatments for headaches and mental health symptoms.
medical_history.family_history: Patient's father had depression; mother and paternal uncle had alcohol and drug use disorders; sister died in her 20s from bone cancer.
medical_history.social_history: Lived with wife and two children; performed childcare duties; history of alcohol consumption (reduced to 3-4 drinks monthly) and daily marijuana use; previous use of chewing tobacco; completed 3 years of college; expressed discouragement from forgetfulness.
